medical_history.chief_complaint: Slowly worsening difficulty walking and painful spasms in legs and arms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age eight, initially presented as inversion of the left foot. Painful spasms started in the left foot approximately two years later, with progression to the left arm and then the right leg over six years. Symptoms worsened over the four months prior to the clinic visit, with improvement in the morning and significant pain, stiffness, and cramping developing by midday and worsening in the evening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with poliomyelitis at age eight, followed by tendon transplantation surgery on left ankle, and subsequently diagnosed with cerebral palsy. Ongoing symptoms of dystonia affecting multiple limbs.
medical_history.family_history: Father had leg pains and cramping without gait disturbance; maternal cousin is dyslexic. One sister is healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Moved to the United States two years before the visit. No additional lifestyle factors or habits mentioned.
